de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Debugger

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.Debugger

  • public class Debugger
extends java.lang.Object
    A very simple "printf"-type debugger.

    Class Debugger opens a scrollable popup up window, the first time its printmethod is called and displays all subsequent messages that will be output via the print message. Class Debugger is useful for doing rudimentary debuggers in browsers other than the GWT hosted mode browser (for which the eclipse debugger and GWT.log() can be used).

    Author:
    ecki

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static Button closeButton
      the close button of the debugger
      protected static boolean closedManually
      flag to indicate whether the debugger was closed by the user
      protected static DialogBox dialog
      the dialog box that the debugger pops up
      protected static VerticalPanel messagePanel
      the panel on which the debuggers messages are displayed
      protected static VerticalPanel panel
      the master panel containing the scroll panel and the close button
      protected static ScrollPanel scrollPanel
      the scroll panel which contains the message panel
      protected static Debugger singleton
      the sole instance of class debugger

      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Debugger()
      The constructor of the debugger.

      Hides the debugger if it is visible.

      Sets the size of the debugger

    • Constructor Detail

      • Debugger

        protected Debugger()
        The constructor of the debugger. As class Debugger is instantiated by the first call to its static print method, this constructor is a protected constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • hide

        public static void hide()
        Hides the debugger if it is visible.

      • print

        public static void print(java.lang.String txt)
        Opens the debugger window (if it was closed) and prints a message in the debugger window.
        Parameters:
        txt - the message to be printed in the debugger's window

      • setSize

        public static void setSize(int width,
           int height)
        Sets the size of the debugger
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the debugger in pixel
        height - the height of the debugger in pixel

      • show

        public static void show()
        Shows the debugger window, if it was hidden or instantiates the debugger and opens the debugger window, if the debugger was not yet instatiated.

      • snapDialog

        public static void snapDialog(boolean right,
              boolean bottom)
        Determines the corner to which the debugger window shall "snap".
        Parameters:
        right - if true, the debugger window "snaps" to the right
        bottom - if true, the debugger window "snaps" to the bottom

      • init

        protected static void init()
        Instantiates the debugger class. Because debugger is a singleton, an error will be raised, if this method is called for the second time.

      • onResize

        public void onResize(ResizeEvent event)
